What would an example of the coin flip look like in R

```{r}
alpha <- 2 ; beta <- 2 #This represents us setting our prior beta (2,2)
heads <- 7 ; tails <- 3.   #This is our actual data

post_a <- alpha + heads
post_b <- beta + tails

```

How to do Grid intuition

```{r}
library(brms)
# grid for coin p
p_grid <- seq(0, 1, length.out = 1000)   #To resemble 1000 flips
prior <- dbeta(p_grid, 2, 2) # prior belief
lik <- dbinom(heads, size = heads+tails, prob = p_grid) # likelihood of data
posterior <- prior * lik
posterior <- posterior / sum(posterior)


# sample from the grid posterior
set.seed(1)
draws <- sample(p_grid, size = 20000, replace = TRUE, prob = posterior)
quantile(draws, c(.05,.5,.95))
```
